EasyMareyMap 0.3.0

    • How to estimate local recombination rates with the Marey map method

    Global function estimate the recombination map

    recombination_map.Rd

    Global function estimate the recombination map

    recombination_map(
  x,
  method = "loess",
  K = 5,
  boot = 1000,
  n_cores = 1,
  smoothing = numeric(),
  n_resampling = 1000,
  calibration_range = c(0.2, 0.5),
  degree = 2,
  windows = 10^5,
  set_negative_values = 0,
  verbose = TRUE
)

    Arguments

    x

    a `marey_map` object.

    method

    an interpolation method, either 'loess' or 'splines' (default = 'loess').

    K

    number of clusters to subset in K-fold cross-validation.

    boot

    number of bootstraps to estimate the confidence interval.

    n_cores

    number of cores to parallelize.

    smoothing

    (optional) smoothing parameter, if you do not want to calibrate it.

    n_resampling

    number of iterations in the cross-validation procedure.

    calibration_range

    range of the smoothing parameter space to explore.

    degree

    (optional) the degree parameter of the polynomial used in the 'loess' method.

    windows

    size or coordinates of the windows along the chromosome: either integer in basepairs (default = 10^5) or a data.frame of start/end coordinates.

    set_negative_values

    the value (e.g. 0 or NA) to use for negative values in recombination rates (default = 0).

    verbose

    Whether to print messages and progress bars at each step (default = TRUE).

    Value

    a `marey_map` object with the estimated recombination map.

    Contents

    Developed by Thomas Brazier.
